textContent:
My feelings 
- I shared how I was feeling with you
- fearful of the direction Ben's wellbeing will go if he continues to absorb a diet of violence 
- why I feel this way 
- why it bothers me that I feel you see a completely different reality from what I observe 
- in addition there was no acknowledgement of my feelings and no statements acknowledging the care I'm tryin to demonstrate for Ben 
- what I heard was "maybe I should he asking my questions" aka it's my fault 
- what I didn't hear was any acknowledgement of the love and care for my family
- What I shared with you previously was a clear overwhelm around how to parent 

What bothers me is that I feel the effort into building our relationship is one directional. If I don't push to grow we don't. If I don't hold us accountable for building depth you won't. 

What hurts is sharing very clearly optimism and appreciation of commitment - of being able to disagree and still know we will be there for each other. Yet you didn't respond or say anything to even acknowledge this. 

When I feel like I'm carrying the relationship I starting doubting. Am I forcing this relationship into being when, left to its own volition, we would drift apart? That's a really crappy feeling. 

When you don't say anything and then respond with this when I ask - " I'd like to come together but not sure I know how to say what I'm feeling. Not sure if I don't word it correctly that it won't make things worse. Whatever is bothering me feels overwhelming to try and make sense of. I'd rather push it away because I don't even know where I would start to try and figure it out. Not even sure if an y of this is making sense."

I feel like you wouldn't say anything unless I keep pushing. And again, when do you take responsibility for owning your needs and building intimacy you want? 

So I feel frustrated, unseen, unappreciated, and seperste from you. I don't like it. And yet this happens 

So what do we do about it?
title: Feelings Convo - Hold for Ready
textContentHtml:
My feelings 

- I shared how I was feeling with you

- fearful of the direction Ben's wellbeing will go if he continues to absorb a diet of violence 

- why I feel this way 

- why it bothers me that I feel you see a completely different reality from what I observe 

- in addition there was no acknowledgement of my feelings and no statements acknowledging the care I'm tryin to demonstrate for Ben 

- what I heard was "maybe I should he asking my questions" aka it's my fault 

- what I didn't hear was any acknowledgement of the love and care for my family

- What I shared with you previously was a clear overwhelm around how to parent 


What bothers me is that I feel the effort into building our relationship is one directional. If I don't push to grow we don't. If I don't hold us accountable for building depth you won't. 


What hurts is sharing very clearly optimism and appreciation of commitment - of being able to disagree and still know we will be there for each other. Yet you didn't respond or say anything to even acknowledge this. 


When I feel like I'm carrying the relationship I starting doubting. Am I forcing this relationship into being when, left to its own volition, we would drift apart? That's a really crappy feeling. 


When you don't say anything and then respond with this when I ask - " I'd like to come together but not sure I know how to say what I'm feeling. Not sure if I don't word it correctly that it won't make things worse. Whatever is bothering me feels overwhelming to try and make sense of. I'd rather push it away because I don't even know where I would start to try and figure it out. Not even sure if an y of this is making sense."


I feel like you wouldn't say anything unless I keep pushing. And again, when do you take responsibility for owning your needs and building intimacy you want? 


So I feel frustrated, unseen, unappreciated, and seperste from you. I don't like it. And yet this happens 


So what do we do about it?
